about.title: About Me
about.intro: I'm a code enthusiast with 15+ years of turning coffee into high-performance web applications. I don't have superpowers, but I love creating smooth user experiences like water. I've had the privilege of working with some pretty cool brands like Autodesk, General Motors, Frontier, Carnival Cruise, Telmex, Presidency of Mexico and Coca-Cola.

companies.title: Freelance
companies.description: • Working as a freelancer creating web applications and designing for different clients and projects

companies.title: Globant
companies.description:
• Behind the decision of planning and execution of Autodesk's high-traffic Profile single-page application, resulting in a 30% performance improvement and a more unified brand design and a better user experience using React, GraphQL, Node, AWS, Microservices.
  • Developed a highly configurable package module and a library of reusable components, enabling easy integration into other projects by external teams. This module allows users to update and save their profile settings and preferences.
  • Team leader involved in the design and development of a WordPress blog for Frontier Communications, recognized as a finalist for Best Blog 2020 at the US Social Media Awards for Pub-Con.
  • Technical leader for Carnival Cruise Cinema App, which led to choose movies, read reviews, watch trailers, get showtimes, purchase tickets, and redeem them at the theater using Angular as the front-end framework and REST API.
  • Developed an interactive tool with D3.js and AngularJS that led to visualize all the different products and their interconnected relationships through an animated tree graph for Autodesk PLM 360.

companies.title: 5M2
companies.description:
• Supervised the front-end development of GOB.mx. Transformed many government procedures from office-based to digital, improving accessibility and efficiency for hundreds of millions of users focusing on performance, user experience and accessibility.
  • Led the creation of a style guide framework for public administration agencies and ministries. Organized and led meetings with technical directors across the country, successfully implementing a unified brand design with detailed code and integration guidance nationwide.

companies.title: Telmex
companies.description: • Contributed to the redesign and reconstruction of telmex.com, effectively transforming it into one of Latin America's most heavily visited websites

companies.title: Interalia
companies.role: Web Designer Sr. / Front End Developer

• Development of multiple websites promoting different new brands and models for General Motors like Chevrolet, Buick and Cadillac using vanilla JS and jQuery for their highly interactive websites.

  • Redesign of company's logo and brand by being selected among dozen other proposals made by other graphic designers.

projects.title: Highlighted Projects
projects.description: Here are some of the projects I've worked on.

apps.title: Profile Autodesk
apps.description: An user-centric approach that balanced functionality and aesthetic appeal. Utilizing Figma for design and adhering to Autodesk's brand guidelines, we engaged in continuous discussions to make informed decisions on the application's design and implementation. This close-knit collaboration ensured that both technical and visual aspects were seamlessly integrated, resulting in a robust and intuitive application that met the performance and usability needs of high-traffic users.

apps.title: Blog Frontier
apps.description: My creative solution for the project involved bringing the product owners' ideas to life with a strong focus on user experience. I was responsible for creating detailed user flows and wireframes, designing high-fidelity mockups, and leading a small development team to build the project. We developed a custom WordPress template tailored to our needs, ensuring a seamless and engaging user experience. Our efforts culminated in the blog becoming a finalist for Best Blog 2020 at the US Social Media Awards for Pub-Con, reflecting the success and impact of our work.
